definitions.definition: An exclusive hereditary or official right or privilege .
A right, or power that is exclusive to a monarch etc, especially such a power to make a decision or judgement .
examples: Despite being a constitutional monarchy , the British sovereign still retain many royal prerogatives .

definitions.definition: A right , especially when due to one's position or role.
A property , attribute or ability which gives one a superiority or advantage over others; an inherent advantage or privilege; a talent .

main_definition: An exclusive hereditary or official right or privilege .
secondary_definitions: A right, or power that is exclusive to a monarch etc, especially such a power to make a decision or judgement .
A right , especially when due to one's position or role.
A property , attribute or ability which gives one a superiority or advantage over others; an inherent advantage or privilege; a talent .
